meanings.definition: The state of not occurring at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The asynchrony of their footsteps echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent2: The asynchrony between the two dancers was evident in their movements.
meanings.sent3: The asynchrony of the clowns' jokes made the audience laugh even harder.
meanings.sent4: The asynchrony of nature's rhythms can be both chaotic and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The asynchrony of the traffic lights caused confusion among drivers.

meanings.sent1: The team's asynchrony in their dance routine was noticeable to the judges.
meanings.sent2: The asynchrony in the orchestra's performance created a dissonant sound.
meanings.sent3: The asynchrony of the chef's cooking led to a deliciously disastrous meal.
meanings.sent4: The asynchrony of the gears in the clock made time seem unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The asynchrony of the students' movements in the play added an unexpected element.
